attributeResults.documentation: A list of objects containing information about the last used intent at the time of an utterance.

AnalyticsUtteranceResult.documentation: An object containing the results for the utterance metrics you requested and the bin and/or group(s) they refer to, if applicable.

transcript.documentation: The content of the transcript that meets the search filter criteria. For the JSON format of the transcript, see Output transcript format.

AssociatedTranscript.documentation: The object containing information that associates the recommended intent/slot type with a conversation.

name.documentation: The name of the field to use for filtering. The allowed names are IntentId and SlotTypeId.

values.documentation: The values to use to filter the transcript.

AssociatedTranscriptFilter.documentation: Filters to search for the associated transcript.

startTimeoutMs.documentation: Time for which a bot waits before assuming that the customer isn't going to speak or press a key. This timeout is shared between Audio and DTMF inputs.

AudioAndDTMFInputSpecification.documentation: Specifies the audio and DTMF input specification.

s3Bucket.documentation: The Amazon S3 bucket where the audio log files are stored. The IAM role specified in the roleArn parameter of the CreateBot operation must have permission to write to this bucket.

AudioLogDestination.documentation: The location of audio log files collected when conversation logging is enabled for a bot.

enabled.documentation: Determines whether audio logging in enabled for the bot.

selectiveLoggingEnabled.documentation: The option to enable selective conversation log capture for audio.

AudioLogSetting.documentation: Settings for logging audio of conversations between Amazon Lex and a user. You specify whether to log audio and the Amazon S3 bucket where the audio file is stored.

maxLengthMs.documentation: Time for how long Amazon Lex waits before speech input is truncated and the speech is returned to application.

endTimeoutMs.documentation: Time for which a bot waits after the customer stops speaking to assume the utterance is finished.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this custom vocabulary is used. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported Languages .

customVocabularyItemList.documentation: A list of new custom vocabulary items. Each entry must contain a phrase and can optionally contain a displayAs and/or a weight.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this custom vocabulary is used. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported Languages .

errors.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items that failed to create during the operation. The reason for the error is contained within each error object.

resources.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items that were successfully created during the operation.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this custom vocabulary is used. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported Languages .

customVocabularyItemList.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items requested to be deleted. Each entry must contain the unique custom vocabulary entry identifier.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this custom vocabulary is used. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lexv2/latest/dg/how-languages.html).

errors.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items that failed to delete during the operation. The reason for the error is contained within each error object.

resources.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items that were successfully deleted during the operation.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this custom vocabulary is used. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported Languages .

customVocabularyItemList.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items with updated fields. Each entry must contain a phrase and can optionally contain a displayAs and/or a weight.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the version of the bot associated with this custom vocabulary.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this custom vocabulary is used. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported Languages .

errors.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items that failed to update during the operation. The reason for the error is contained within each error object.

resources.documentation: A list of custom vocabulary items that were successfully updated during the operation.

identifier.documentation: The unique guardrail id for the Bedrock guardrail configuration.

version.documentation: The guardrail version for the Bedrock guardrail configuration.

BedrockGuardrailConfiguration.documentation: The details on the Bedrock guardrail configuration.

bedrockKnowledgeBaseArn.documentation: The base ARN of the knowledge base used.

exactResponse.documentation: Specifies whether to return an exact response, or to return an answer generated by the model, using the fields you specify from the database.

exactResponseFields.documentation: Contains the names of the fields used for an exact response to the user.

BedrockKnowledgeStoreConfiguration.documentation: Contains details about the configuration of a Amazon Bedrock knowledge base.

answerField.documentation: The answer field used for an exact response from Bedrock Knowledge Store.

BedrockKnowledgeStoreExactResponseFields.documentation: The exact response fields given by the Bedrock knowledge store.

modelArn.documentation: The ARN of the foundation model used in descriptive bot building.

guardrail.documentation: The guardrail configuration in the Bedrock model specification details.

traceStatus.documentation: The Bedrock trace status in the Bedrock model specification details.

customPrompt.documentation: The custom prompt used in the Bedrock model specification details.

BedrockModelSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon Bedrock model used to interpret the prompt used in descriptive bot building.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that was used in the event.

startDate.documentation: The date and time that the event started.

endDate.documentation: The date and time that the event ended.

BotAliasHistoryEvent.documentation: Provides a record of an event that affects a bot alias. For example, when the version of a bot that the alias points to changes.

enabled.documentation: Determines whether the locale is enabled for the bot. If the value is false, the locale isn't available for use.

codeHookSpecification.documentation: Specifies the Lambda function that should be used in the locale.

BotAliasLocaleSettings.documentation: Specifies settings that are unique to a locale. For example, you can use different Lambda function depending on the bot's locale.

botAliasId.documentation: The bot alias ID for all the alias bot replications.

botAliasReplicationStatus.documentation: The replication statuses for all the alias bot replications.

botVersion.documentation: The bot version for all the alias bot replications.

creationDateTime.documentation: The creation time and date for all the alias bot replications.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The last time and date updated for all the alias bot replications.

failureReasons.documentation: The reasons for failure for the aliases bot replications.

BotAliasReplicaSummary.documentation: Contains information about all the aliases replication statuses applicable for global resiliency.

BotAliasReplicationStatus.documentation: The status of the operation to replicate the bot alias. Values: Creating, Updating, Available, Deleting, Failed.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the bot alias. You can use this ID to get detailed information about the alias using the DescribeBotAlias operation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that the bot alias references.

botAliasStatus.documentation: The current state of the bot alias. If the status is Available, the alias is ready for use.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot alias was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot alias was last updated.

BotAliasSummary.documentation: Summary information about bot aliases returned from the ListBotAliases operation.

botId.documentation: The bot Id of the bot alias used in the test set execution.

botAliasId.documentation: The bot alias Id of the bot alias used in the test set execution.

localeId.documentation: The locale Id of the bot alias used in the test set execution.

BotAliasTestExecutionTarget.documentation: The target Amazon S3 location for the test set execution using a bot alias.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot assigned by Amazon Lex.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that was exported. This will be either DRAFT or the version number.

BotExportSpecification.documentation: Provides the identity of a the bot that was exported.

name.documentation: The name of the field to filter the list of bots.

values.documentation: The value to use for filtering the list of bots.

operator.documentation: The operator to use for the filter. Specify EQ when the ListBots operation should return only aliases that equal the specified value. Specify CO when the ListBots operation should return aliases that contain the specified value.

BotFilter.documentation: Filters the responses returned by the ListBots operation.

botName.documentation: The name that Amazon Lex should use for the bot.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used to build and run the bot.

errorLogSettings.documentation: Allows you to configure destinations where error logs will be published during the bot import process.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation:
The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.

You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

botTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateBot operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

testBotAliasTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you import a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.

BotImportSpecification.documentation: Provides the bot parameters required for importing a bot.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to create the locale for.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to export.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale to export. The string must match one of the locales in the bot.

BotLocaleExportSpecification.documentation: Provides the bot locale parameters required for exporting a bot locale.

name.documentation: The name of the field to filter the list of bots.

values.documentation: The value to use for filtering the list of bots.

operator.documentation: The operator to use for the filter. Specify EQ when the ListBotLocales operation should return only aliases that equal the specified value. Specify CO when the ListBotLocales operation should return aliases that contain the specified value.

event.documentation: A description of the event that occurred.

eventDate.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the event occurred.

BotLocaleHistoryEvent.documentation: Provides information about an event that occurred affecting the bot locale.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to import the locale to.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to import the locale to. This can only be the DRAFT version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation:
Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.

For example, suppose a bot is configured with the confidence threshold of 0.80 and the AMAZON.FallbackIntent. Amazon Lex returns three alternative intents with the following confidence scores: IntentA (0.70), IntentB (0.60), IntentC (0.50). The response from the PostText operation would be:

  • AMAZON.FallbackIntent

  • IntentA

  • IntentB

  • IntentC

BotLocaleImportSpecification.documentation: Provides the bot locale parameters required for importing a bot locale.

attribute.documentation: The bot locale attribute to sort by.

order.documentation: Specifies whether to sort the bot locales in ascending or descending order.

BotLocaleSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of bot locales.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale of the bot locale.

botLocaleStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot locale. When the status is Built the locale is ready for use.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot locale was last updated.

lastBuildSubmittedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot locale was last built.

BotLocaleSummary.documentation: Summary information about bot locales returned by the ListBotLocales operation.

botMemberId.documentation: The unique ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

botMemberName.documentation: The unique name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

botMemberAliasId.documentation: The alias ID of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

botMemberAliasName.documentation: The alias name of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

botMemberVersion.documentation: The version of a bot that is a member of this network of bots.

BotMember.documentation: A bot that is a member of a network of bots.

intents.documentation: Statistical information about about the intents associated with the bot recommendation results.

slotTypes.documentation: Statistical information about the slot types associated with the bot recommendation results.

BotRecommendationResultStatistics.documentation: A statistical summary of the bot recommendation results.

botLocaleExportUrl.documentation: The presigned URL link of the recommended bot definition.

associatedTranscriptsUrl.documentation: The presigned url link of the associated transcript.

statistics.documentation: The statistical summary of the bot recommendation results.

BotRecommendationResults.documentation: The object representing the URL of the bot definition, the URL of the associated transcript, and a statistical summary of the bot recommendation results.

botRecommendationStatus.documentation:
The status of the bot recommendation.

If the status is Failed, then the reasons for the failure are listed in the failureReasons field.

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation to be updated.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot recommendation was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot recommendation was last updated.

BotReplicaStatus.documentation: The status of the operation to replicate the bot. Values: Enabling, Enabled, Deleting, Failed.

replicaRegion.documentation: The replica region used in the replication statuses summary.

creationDateTime.documentation: The creation time and date for the replicated bots.

botReplicaStatus.documentation: The operation status for the replicated bot applicable.

failureReasons.documentation: The reasons for the failure for the replicated bot.

BotReplicaSummary.documentation: Contains summary information about all the replication statuses applicable for global resiliency.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of bots.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can choose ascending or descending.

BotSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of bots.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the bot. Use this ID to get detailed information about the bot with the DescribeBot operation.

botStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot. When the status is Available the bot is ready for use.

latestBotVersion.documentation: The latest numerical version in use for the bot.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the bot was last updated.

BotSummary.documentation: Summary information about a bot returned by the ListBots operation.

sourceBotVersion.documentation: The version of a bot used for a bot locale.

BotVersionLocaleDetails.documentation: The version of a bot used for a bot locale.

attribute.documentation: The attribute of the sort category for the version replicated bots.

order.documentation: The order of the sort category for the version replicated bots.

BotVersionReplicaSortBy.documentation: The sort category for the version replicated bots.

botVersion.documentation: The bot version for the summary information for all the version replication statuses.

botVersionReplicationStatus.documentation: The version replication status for all the replicated bots.

creationDateTime.documentation: The creation date and time of the replication status for all the replicated bots.

failureReasons.documentation: The reasons for replication failure for all the replicated bots.

BotVersionReplicaSummary.documentation: Contains summary information for all the version replication statuses applicable for Global resiliency.

BotVersionReplicationStatus.documentation: The status of the operation to replicate the bot version. Values: Creating, Available, Deleting, Failed.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of versions.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can specify ascending or descending order.

BotVersionSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of bot versions.

botName.documentation: The name of the bot associated with the version.

botVersion.documentation: The numeric version of the bot, or DRAFT to indicate that this is the version of the bot that can be updated..

botStatus.documentation: The status of the bot. When the status is available, the version of the bot is ready for use.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the version was created.

BotVersionSummary.documentation: Summary information about a bot version returned by the ListBotVersions operation.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to build. The identifier is returned in the response from the CreateBot operation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to build. This can only be the draft version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the specified bot.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that was built. This is only the draft version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale specified of where the bot can be used.

botLocaleStatus.documentation: The bot's build status. When the status is ReadyExpressTesting you can test the bot using the utterances defined for the intents and slot types. When the status is Built, the bot is ready for use and can be tested using any utterance.

lastBuildSubmittedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp indicating the date and time that the bot was last built for this locale.

descriptiveBotBuilder.documentation: An object containing specifications for the descriptive bot building feature.

sampleUtteranceGeneration.documentation: Contains specifications for the sample utterance generation feature.

BuildtimeSettings.documentation: Contains specifications about the Amazon Lex build time generative AI capabilities from Amazon Bedrock that you can turn on for your bot.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of built-in intents.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can specify ascending or descending order.

BuiltInIntentSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of built-in intents.

intentSignature.documentation: The signature of the built-in intent. Use this to specify the parent intent of a derived intent.

BuiltInIntentSummary.documentation: Provides summary information about a built-in intent for the ListBuiltInIntents operation.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of built-in intents.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can choose ascending or descending.

BuiltInSlotTypeSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of built-in slot types.

slotTypeSignature.documentation: The signature of the built-in slot type. Use this to specify the parent slot type of a derived slot type.

description.documentation: The description of the built-in slot type.

BuiltInSlotTypeSummary.documentation: Provides summary information about a built-in slot type for the ListBuiltInSlotTypes operation.

text.documentation: The text that appears on the button. Use this to tell the user what value is returned when they choose this button.

value.documentation: The value returned to Amazon Lex when the user chooses this button. This must be one of the slot values configured for the slot.

Button.documentation: Describes a button to use on a response card used to gather slot values from a user.

cloudWatchLogGroupArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the log group where text and metadata logs are delivered.

logPrefix.documentation: The prefix of the log stream name within the log group that you specified

CloudWatchLogGroupLogDestination.documentation: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group where the text and metadata logs are delivered. The log group must exist before you enable logging.

CodeHookSpecification.documentation: Contains information about code hooks that Amazon Lex calls during a conversation.

CompositeSlotTypeSetting.documentation: A composite slot is a combination of two or more slots that capture multiple pieces of information in a single user input.

Condition.documentation: Provides an expression that evaluates to true or false.

name.documentation: The name of the branch.

condition.documentation: Contains the expression to evaluate. If the condition is true, the branch's actions are taken.

ConditionalBranch.documentation: A set of actions that Amazon Lex should run if the condition is matched.

active.documentation: Determines whether a conditional branch is active. When active is false, the conditions are not evaluated.

conditionalBranches.documentation: A list of conditional branches. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step. The response and next step are executed when the condition is true.

defaultBranch.documentation: The conditional branch that should be followed when the conditions for other branches are not satisfied. A conditional branch is made up of a condition, a response and a next step.

ConditionalSpecification.documentation: Provides a list of conditional branches. Branches are evaluated in the order that they are entered in the list. The first branch with a condition that evaluates to true is executed. The last branch in the list is the default branch. The default branch should not have any condition expression. The default branch is executed if no other branch has a matching condition.

ConflictException.documentation: The action that you tried to perform couldn't be completed because the resource is in a conflicting state. For example, deleting a bot that is in the CREATING state. Try your request again.

intentName.documentation: The intent name used in the evaluation of intent level success or failure.

matchResult.documentation: The number of times the specific intent is used in the evaluation of intent level success or failure.

ConversationLevelIntentClassificationRes.documentation: The item listing the evaluation of intent level success or failure.

endToEndResult.documentation: The success or failure of the streaming of the conversation.

speechTranscriptionResult.documentation: The speech transcription success or failure details of the conversation.

ConversationLevelResultDetail.documentation: The conversation level details of the conversation used in the test set.

intentName.documentation: The intents used in the slots list for the slot resolution details.

slotName.documentation: The slot name in the slots list for the slot resolution details.

matchResult.documentation: The number of matching slots used in the slots listings for the slot resolution evaluation.

ConversationLevelSlotResolutionResultIte.documentation: The slots used for the slot resolution in the conversation.

conversationId.documentation: The conversation Id of the test result evaluation item.

endToEndResult.documentation: The end-to-end success or failure of the test result evaluation item.

speechTranscriptionResult.documentation: The speech transcription success or failure of the test result evaluation item.

intentClassificationResults.documentation: The intent classification of the test result evaluation item.

slotResolutionResults.documentation: The slot success or failure of the test result evaluation item.

ConversationLevelTestResultItem.documentation: The test result evaluation item at the conversation level.

items.documentation: The item list in the test set results data at the conversation level.

ConversationLevelTestResults.documentation: The test set results data at the conversation level.

endToEndResult.documentation: The selection of matched or mismatched end-to-end status to filter test set results data at the conversation level.

ConversationLevelTestResultsFilterBy.documentation: The selection to filter the test set results data at the conversation level.

textLogSettings.documentation: The Amazon CloudWatch Logs settings for logging text and metadata.

audioLogSettings.documentation: The Amazon S3 settings for logging audio to an S3 bucket.

ConversationLogSettings.documentation: Configures conversation logging that saves audio, text, and metadata for the conversations with your users.

botId.documentation: The bot Id from the conversation logs.

botAliasId.documentation: The bot alias Id from the conversation logs.

localeId.documentation: The locale Id of the conversation log.

filter.documentation: The filter for the data source of the conversation log.

ConversationLogsDataSource.documentation: The data source that uses conversation logs.

startTime.documentation: The start time for the conversation log.

endTime.documentation: The end time for the conversation log.

inputMode.documentation: The selection to filter by input mode for the conversation logs.

ConversationLogsDataSourceFilterBy.documentation: The selected data source to filter the conversation log.

botAliasName.documentation: The alias to create. The name must be unique for the bot.

description.documentation: A description of the alias. Use this description to help identify the alias.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that this alias points to. You can use the UpdateBotAlias operation to change the bot version associated with the alias.

botAliasLocaleSettings.documentation: Maps configuration information to a specific locale. You can use this parameter to specify a specific Lambda function to run different functions in different locales.

conversationLogSettings.documentation: Specifies whether Amazon Lex logs text and audio for a conversation with the bot. When you enable conversation logs, text logs store text input, transcripts of audio input, and associated metadata in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Audio logs store audio input in Amazon S3.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that the alias applies to.

tags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the bot alias. You can only add tags when you create an alias, you can't use the UpdateBotAlias operation to update the tags on a bot alias. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot alias.

botAliasName.documentation: The name specified for the bot alias.

description.documentation: The description specified for the bot alias.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with this alias.

conversationLogSettings.documentation: The conversation log settings specified for the alias.

botAliasStatus.documentation: The current status of the alias. The alias is first put into the Creating state. When the alias is ready to be used, it is put into the Available state. You can use the DescribeBotAlias operation to get the current state of an alias.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that this alias applies to.

creationDateTime.documentation: A Unix timestamp indicating the date and time that the bot alias was created.

tags.documentation: A list of tags associated with the bot alias.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to create the locale for.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot to create the locale for. This can only be the draft version of the bot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the bot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the intents, slot types, and slots used in the bot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

description.documentation: A description of the bot locale. Use this to help identify the bot locale in lists.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation:
Determines the threshold where Amazon Lex will insert the AMAZON.FallbackIntent, AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent, or both when returning alternative intents. AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent are only inserted if they are configured for the bot.

For example, suppose a bot is configured with the confidence threshold of 0.80 and the AMAZON.FallbackIntent. Amazon Lex returns three alternative intents with the following confidence scores: IntentA (0.70), IntentB (0.60), IntentC (0.50). The response from the RecognizeText operation would be:

  • AMAZON.FallbackIntent

  • IntentA

  • IntentB

  • IntentC

voiceSettings.documentation: The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

botId.documentation: The specified bot identifier.

botVersion.documentation: The specified bot version.

localeId.documentation: The specified locale identifier.

description.documentation: The specified description of the bot locale.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation: The specified confidence threshold for inserting the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents.

voiceSettings.documentation: The Amazon Polly voice ID that Amazon Lex uses for voice interaction with the user.

botLocaleStatus.documentation:
The status of the bot.

When the status is Creating the bot locale is being configured. When the status is Building Amazon Lex is building the bot for testing and use.

If the status of the bot is ReadyExpressTesting, you can test the bot using the exact utterances specified in the bots' intents. When the bot is ready for full testing or to run, the status is Built.

If there was a problem with building the bot, the status is Failed. If the bot was saved but not built, the status is NotBuilt.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp specifying the date and time that the bot locale was created.

botId.documentation: The request for the unique bot ID of the source bot to be replicated in the secondary region.

replicaRegion.documentation: The request for the secondary region that will be used in the replication of the source bot.

botId.documentation: The unique bot ID of the replicated bot generated.

replicaRegion.documentation: The region of the replicated bot generated.

sourceRegion.documentation: The source region for the source bot used for the replicated bot generated.

creationDateTime.documentation: The creation date and time of the replicated bot generated.

botReplicaStatus.documentation: The operational status of the replicated bot generated.

botName.documentation: The name of the bot. The bot name must be unique in the account that creates the bot.

description.documentation: A description of the bot. It appears in lists to help you identify a particular bot.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the bot.

dataPrivacy.documentation: Provides information on additional privacy protections Amazon Lex should use with the bot's data.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation:
The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.

You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

botTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the bot. You can only add tags when you create a bot. You can't use the UpdateBot operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

testBotAliasTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the test alias for a bot. You can only add tags when you create a bot. You can't use the UpdateAlias operation to update tags. To update tags on the test alias, use the TagResource operation.

botType.documentation: The type of a bot to create.

botMembers.documentation: The list of bot members in a network to be created.

errorLogSettings.documentation: Specifies the configuration for error logging during bot creation.

botId.documentation: A unique identifier for a particular bot. You use this to identify the bot when you call other Amazon Lex API operations.

roleArn.documentation: The IAM role specified for the bot.

dataPrivacy.documentation: The data privacy settings specified for the bot.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation: The session idle time specified for the bot.

botStatus.documentation: Shows the current status of the bot. The bot is first in the Creating status. Once the bot is read for use, it changes to the Available status. After the bot is created, you can use the DRAFT version of the bot.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp indicating the date and time that the bot was created.

botTags.documentation: A list of tags associated with the bot.

testBotAliasTags.documentation: A list of tags associated with the test alias for the bot.

botType.documentation: The type of a bot that was created.

botMembers.documentation: The list of bots in a network that was created.

errorLogSettings.documentation: Specifies configuration settings for delivering error logs to Cloudwatch Logs in an Amazon Lex bot response.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot to create the version for.

description.documentation: A description of the version. Use the description to help identify the version in lists.

botVersionLocaleSpecification.documentation: Specifies the locales that Amazon Lex adds to this version. You can choose the Draft version or any other previously published version for each locale. When you specify a source version, the locale data is copied from the source version to the new version.

botId.documentation: The bot identifier specified in the request.

description.documentation: The description of the version specified in the request.

botVersion.documentation: The version number assigned to the version.

botVersionLocaleSpecification.documentation: The source versions used for each locale in the new version.

botStatus.documentation: When you send a request to create or update a bot, Amazon Lex sets the status response element to Creating. After Amazon Lex builds the bot, it sets status to Available. If Amazon Lex can't build the bot, it sets status to Failed.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the version was created.

resourceSpecification.documentation: Specifies the type of resource to export, either a bot or a bot locale. You can only specify one type of resource to export.

fileFormat.documentation: The file format of the bot or bot locale definition files.

filePassword.documentation: An password to use to encrypt the exported archive. Using a password is optional, but you should encrypt the archive to protect the data in transit between Amazon Lex and your local computer.

exportId.documentation: An identifier for a specific request to create an export.

resourceSpecification.documentation: A description of the type of resource that was exported, either a bot or a bot locale.

fileFormat.documentation: The file format used for the bot or bot locale definition files.

exportStatus.documentation: The status of the export. When the status is Completed, you can use the DescribeExport operation to get the pre-signed S3 URL link to your exported bot or bot locale.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the request to export a bot was created.

intentName.documentation: The name of the intent. Intent names must be unique in the locale that contains the intent and cannot match the name of any built-in intent.

description.documentation: A description of the intent. Use the description to help identify the intent in lists.

parentIntentSignature.documentation: A unique identifier for the built-in intent to base this intent on.

sampleUtterances.documentation:
An array of strings that a user might say to signal the intent. For example, "I want a pizza", or "I want a {PizzaSize} pizza".

In an utterance, slot names are enclosed in curly braces ("{", "}") to indicate where they should be displayed in the utterance shown to the user..

dialogCodeHook.documentation:
Specifies that Amazon Lex invokes the alias Lambda function for each user input. You can invoke this Lambda function to personalize user interaction.

For example, suppose that your bot determines that the user's name is John. You Lambda function might retrieve John's information from a backend database and prepopulate some of the values. For example, if you find that John is gluten intolerant, you might set the corresponding intent slot, glutenIntolerant to true. You might find John's phone number and set the corresponding session attribute.

fulfillmentCodeHook.documentation:
Specifies that Amazon Lex invokes the alias Lambda function when the intent is ready for fulfillment. You can invoke this function to complete the bot's transaction with the user.

For example, in a pizza ordering bot, the Lambda function can look up the closest pizza restaurant to the customer's location and then place an order on the customer's behalf.

intentConfirmationSetting.documentation: Provides prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to confirm the completion of an intent. If the user answers "no," the settings contain a statement that is sent to the user to end the intent.

intentClosingSetting.documentation: Sets the response that Amazon Lex sends to the user when the intent is closed.

inputContexts.documentation:
A list of contexts that must be active for this intent to be considered by Amazon Lex.

When an intent has an input context list, Amazon Lex only considers using the intent in an interaction with the user when the specified contexts are included in the active context list for the session. If the contexts are not active, then Amazon Lex will not use the intent.

A context can be automatically activated using the outputContexts property or it can be set at runtime.

For example, if there are two intents with different input contexts that respond to the same utterances, only the intent with the active context will respond.

An intent may have up to 5 input contexts. If an intent has multiple input contexts, all of the contexts must be active to consider the intent.

outputContexts.documentation:
A lists of contexts that the intent activates when it is fulfilled.

You can use an output context to indicate the intents that Amazon Lex should consider for the next turn of the conversation with a customer.

When you use the outputContextsList property, all of the contexts specified in the list are activated when the intent is fulfilled. You can set up to 10 output contexts. You can also set the number of conversation turns that the context should be active, or the length of time that the context should be active.

kendraConfiguration.documentation: Configuration information required to use the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent to connect to an Amazon Kendra index. The AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent is called when Amazon Lex can't determine another intent to invoke.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this intent.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with this intent.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this intent is used. All of the bots, slot types, and slots used by the intent must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

initialResponseSetting.documentation: Configuration settings for the response that is sent to the user at the beginning of a conversation, before eliciting slot values.

qnAIntentConfiguration.documentation: Specifies the configuration of the built-in Amazon.QnAIntent. The AMAZON.QnAIntent intent is called when Amazon Lex can't determine another intent to invoke. If you specify this field, you can't specify the kendraConfiguration field.

qInConnectIntentConfiguration.documentation: Qinconnect intent configuration details for the create intent request.

parentIntentSignature.documentation: The signature of the parent intent specified for the intent.

sampleUtterances.documentation: The sample utterances specified for the intent.

dialogCodeHook.documentation: The dialog Lambda function specified for the intent.

fulfillmentCodeHook.documentation: The fulfillment Lambda function specified for the intent.

intentConfirmationSetting.documentation: The confirmation setting specified for the intent.

intentClosingSetting.documentation: The closing setting specified for the intent.

inputContexts.documentation: The list of input contexts specified for the intent.

outputContexts.documentation: The list of output contexts specified for the intent.

kendraConfiguration.documentation: Configuration for searching a Amazon Kendra index specified for the intent.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the intent.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the intent.

localeId.documentation: The locale that the intent is specified to use.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the intent was created.

initialResponseSetting.documentation: Configuration settings for the response that is sent to the user at the beginning of a conversation, before eliciting slot values.

qnAIntentConfiguration.documentation: Details about the the configuration of the built-in Amazon.QnAIntent.

qInConnectIntentConfiguration.documentation: Qinconnect intent configuration details for the create intent response.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

policy.documentation:
A resource policy to add to the resource. The policy is a JSON structure that contains one or more statements that define the policy. The policy must follow the IAM syntax. For more information about the contents of a JSON policy document, see IAM JSON policy reference .

If the policy isn't valid, Amazon Lex returns a validation exception.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy was attached to.

revisionId.documentation: The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

statementId.documentation: The name of the statement. The ID is the same as the Sid IAM property. The statement name must be unique within the policy. For more information, see IAM JSON policy elements: Sid.

effect.documentation: Determines whether the statement allows or denies access to the resource.

principal.documentation: An IAM principal, such as an IAM user, IAM role, or Amazon Web Services services that is allowed or denied access to a resource. For more information, see Amazon Web Services JSON policy elements: Principal.

action.documentation: The Amazon Lex action that this policy either allows or denies. The action must apply to the resource type of the specified ARN. For more information, see Actions, resources, and condition keys for Amazon Lex V2.

condition.documentation:
Specifies a condition when the policy is in effect. If the principal of the policy is a service principal, you must provide two condition blocks, one with a SourceAccount global condition key and one with a SourceArn global condition key.

For more information, see IAM JSON policy elements: Condition .

expectedRevisionId.documentation:
The identifier of the revision of the policy to edit. If this revision ID doesn't match the current revision ID, Amazon Lex throws an exception.

If you don't specify a revision, Amazon Lex overwrites the contents of the policy with the new values.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

revisionId.documentation: The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

slotName.documentation: The name of the slot. Slot names must be unique within the bot that contains the slot.

description.documentation: A description of the slot. Use this to help identify the slot in lists.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier for the slot type associated with this slot. The slot type determines the values that can be entered into the slot.

valueElicitationSetting.documentation: Specifies prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to elicit a response that provides the value for the slot.

obfuscationSetting.documentation:
Determines how slot values are used in Amazon CloudWatch logs. If the value of the obfuscationSetting parameter is DefaultObfuscation, slot values are obfuscated in the log output. If the value is None, the actual value is present in the log output.

The default is to obfuscate values in the CloudWatch logs.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with the slot.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the slot.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the slot will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the bots, intents, slot types used by the slot must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

intentId.documentation: The identifier of the intent that contains the slot.

multipleValuesSetting.documentation:
Indicates whether the slot returns multiple values in one response. Multi-value slots are only available in the en-US locale. If you set this value to true in any other locale, Amazon Lex throws a ValidationException.

If the multipleValuesSetting is not set, the default value is false.

subSlotSetting.documentation: Specifications for the constituent sub slots and the expression for the composite slot.

slotId.documentation: The unique identifier associated with the slot. Use this to identify the slot when you update or delete it.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the slot type associated with this slot.

valueElicitationSetting.documentation: The value elicitation settings specified for the slot.

obfuscationSetting.documentation: Indicates whether the slot is configured to obfuscate values in Amazon CloudWatch logs.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot associated with the slot.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot associated with the slot.

localeId.documentation: The language and local specified for the slot.

intentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the intent associated with the slot.

creationDateTime.documentation: The timestamp of the date and time that the slot was created.

multipleValuesSetting.documentation: Indicates whether the slot returns multiple values in one response.

subSlotSetting.documentation: Specifications for the constituent sub slots and the expression for the composite slot.

slotTypeName.documentation: The name for the slot. A slot type name must be unique within the intent.

description.documentation: A description of the slot type. Use the description to help identify the slot type in lists.

slotTypeValues.documentation: A list of SlotTypeValue objects that defines the values that the slot type can take. Each value can have a list of synonyms, additional values that help train the machine learning model about the values that it resolves for a slot.

valueSelectionSetting.documentation:
Determines the strategy that Amazon Lex uses to select a value from the list of possible values. The field can be set to one of the following values:

  • ORIGINAL_VALUE - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value.

  • TOP_RESOLUTION - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list. If there is no resolution list, return null.

If you don't specify the valueSelectionSetting parameter, the default is ORIGINAL_VALUE.

parentSlotTypeSignature.documentation:
The built-in slot type used as a parent of this slot type. When you define a parent slot type, the new slot type has the configuration of the parent slot type.

Only AMAZON.AlphaNumeric is supported.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot associated with this slot type.

botVersion.documentation: The identifier of the bot version associated with this slot type.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that the slot type will be used in. The string must match one of the supported locales. All of the bots, intents, and slots used by the slot type must have the same locale. For more information, see Supported languages.

childDirected.documentation: For each Amazon Lex bot created with the Amazon Lex Model Building Service, you must specify whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) by specifying true or false in the childDirected field. By specifying true in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. By specifying false in the childDirected field, you confirm that your use of Amazon Lex is not related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. You may not specify a default value for the childDirected field that does not accurately reflect whether your use of Amazon Lex is related to a website, program, or other application that is directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13 and subject to COPPA. If your use of Amazon Lex relates to a website, program, or other application that is directed in whole or in part, to children under age 13, you must obtain any required verifiable parental consent under COPPA. For information regarding the use of Amazon Lex in connection with websites, programs, or other applications that are directed or targeted, in whole or in part, to children under age 13, see the Amazon Lex FAQ.

DataPrivacy.documentation: By default, data stored by Amazon Lex is encrypted. The DataPrivacy structure provides settings that determine how Amazon Lex handles special cases of securing the data for your bot.
