timeToLiveInSeconds.documentation: The amount of time, in seconds, that the output context should remain active. The time is figured from the first time the context is sent to the user.

turnsToLive.documentation: The number of conversation turns that the output context should remain active. The number of turns is counted from the first time that the context is sent to the user.

OutputContext.documentation: Describes a session context that is activated when an intent is fulfilled.

multiTurnConversation.documentation: Indicates whether the conversation contains multiple turns or not.

totalResultCount.documentation: The total number of overall results in the result of the test execution.

speechTranscriptionResultCounts.documentation: The number of speech transcription results in the overall test.

OverallTestResultItem.documentation: Information about the overall results for a test execution result.

items.documentation: A list of the overall test results.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the network of bots assigned by Amazon Lex.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the network of bots.

objectPrefixes.documentation: A list of Amazon S3 prefixes that points to sub-folders in the Amazon S3 bucket. Specify this list if you only want Lex to read the files under this set of sub-folders.

PathFormat.documentation: The object that contains a path format that will be applied when Amazon Lex reads the transcript file in the bucket you provide. Specify this object if you only want Lex to read a subset of files in your Amazon S3 bucket.

value.documentation: The message to send to the user.

PlainTextMessage.documentation: Defines an ASCII text message to send to the user.

successNextStep.documentation: Specifics the next step the bot runs after the dialog code hook finishes successfully.

successConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the dialog code hook finishes successfully.

failureNextStep.documentation: Specifies the next step the bot runs after the dialog code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

failureConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the dialog code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

timeoutNextStep.documentation: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the code hook times out.

timeoutConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate if the code hook times out.

PostDialogCodeHookInvocationSpecificatio.documentation: Specifies next steps to run after the dialog code hook finishes.

successNextStep.documentation: Specifies the next step in the conversation that Amazon Lex invokes when the fulfillment code hook completes successfully.

successConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the fulfillment code hook finishes successfully.

failureNextStep.documentation: Specifies the next step the bot runs after the fulfillment code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

failureConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the fulfillment code hook throws an exception or returns with the State field of the Intent object set to Failed.

timeoutNextStep.documentation: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the fulfillment code hook times out.

timeoutConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate if the fulfillment code hook times out.

PostFulfillmentStatusSpecification.documentation: Provides a setting that determines whether the post-fulfillment response is sent to the user. For more information, see https://docs.aws.amazon.com/lexv2/latest/dg/streaming-progress.html#progress-complete

PreconditionFailedException.documentation: Your request couldn't be completed because one or more request fields aren't valid. Check the fields in your request and try again.

service.documentation: The name of the Amazon Web Services service that should allowed or denied access to an Amazon Lex action.

arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the principal.

Principal.documentation: The IAM principal that you allowing or denying access to an Amazon Lex action. You must provide a service or an arn, but not both in the same statement. For more information, see AWS JSON policy elements: Principal .

PromptAttempt.documentation: The attempt name of attempts of a prompt.

allowInterrupt.documentation: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt attempt from the bot.

allowedInputTypes.documentation: Indicates the allowed input types of the prompt attempt.

audioAndDTMFInputSpecification.documentation: Specifies the settings on audio and DTMF input.

PromptAttemptSpecification.documentation: Specifies the settings on a prompt attempt.

messageGroups.documentation: A collection of messages that Amazon Lex can send to the user. Amazon Lex chooses the actual message to send at runtime.

maxRetries.documentation: The maximum number of times the bot tries to elicit a response from the user using this prompt.

allowInterrupt.documentation: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech prompt from the bot.

messageSelectionStrategy.documentation: Indicates how a message is selected from a message group among retries.

promptAttemptsSpecification.documentation: Specifies the advanced settings on each attempt of the prompt.

PromptSpecification.documentation: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex sends to a user to elicit a response.

assistantArn.documentation: The assistant Arn details of the Qinconnect assistant configuration.

QInConnectAssistantConfiguration.documentation: The configuration details of the Qinconnect assistant.

qInConnectAssistantConfiguration.documentation: The Qinconnect assistant configuration details of the Qinconnect intent.

QInConnectIntentConfiguration.documentation: The configuration details of the Qinconnect intent.

dataSourceConfiguration.documentation: Contains details about the configuration of the data source used for the AMAZON.QnAIntent.

QnAIntentConfiguration.documentation: Details about the the configuration of the built-in Amazon.QnAIntent.

kendraIndex.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Kendra index to use.

queryFilterStringEnabled.documentation: Specifies whether to enable an Amazon Kendra filter string or not.

queryFilterString.documentation: Contains the Amazon Kendra filter string to use if enabled. For more information on the Amazon Kendra search filter JSON format, see Using document attributes to filter search results.

exactResponse.documentation: Specifies whether to return an exact response from the Amazon Kendra index or to let the Amazon Bedrock model you select generate a response based on the results. To use this feature, you must first add FAQ questions to your index by following the steps at Adding frequently asked questions (FAQs) to an index.

QnAKendraConfiguration.documentation: Contains details about the configuration of the Amazon Kendra index used for the AMAZON.QnAIntent.

intentId.documentation: The unique identifier of a recommended intent associated with the bot recommendation.

intentName.documentation: The name of a recommended intent associated with the bot recommendation.

sampleUtterancesCount.documentation: The count of sample utterances of a recommended intent that is associated with a bot recommendation.

RecommendedIntentSummary.documentation: An object that contains a summary of a recommended intent.

timeDimension.documentation: The type of time period that the timeValue field represents.

timeValue.documentation:
The period of the time window to gather statistics for. The valid value depends on the setting of the timeDimension field.

  • Hours - 1/3/6/12/24

  • Days - 3

  • Weeks - 1/2

RelativeAggregationDuration.documentation:
Specifies the time window that utterance statistics are returned for. The time window is always relative to the last time that the that utterances were aggregated. For example, if the ListAggregatedUtterances operation is called at 1600, the time window is set to 1 hour, and the last refresh time was 1530, only utterances made between 1430 and 1530 are returned.

You can choose the time window that statistics should be returned for.

  • Hours - You can request utterance statistics for 1, 3, 6, 12, or 24 hour time windows. Statistics are refreshed every half hour for 1 hour time windows, and hourly for the other time windows.

  • Days - You can request utterance statistics for 3 days. Statistics are refreshed every 6 hours.

  • Weeks - You can see statistics for one or two weeks. Statistics are refreshed every 12 hours for one week time windows, and once per day for two week time windows.

ReplicaRegion.documentation: The region that contains the replicated bots. Minimum value = 2, maximum value = 25.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: You asked to describe a resource that doesn't exist. Check the resource that you are requesting and try again.

messageGroups.documentation: A collection of responses that Amazon Lex can send to the user. Amazon Lex chooses the actual response to send at runtime.

allowInterrupt.documentation: Indicates whether the user can interrupt a speech response from Amazon Lex.

ResponseSpecification.documentation: Specifies a list of message groups that Amazon Lex uses to respond the user input.

runtimeHintValues.documentation: One or more strings that Amazon Lex should look for in the input to the bot. Each phrase is given preference when deciding on slot values.

subSlotHints.documentation: A map of constituent sub slot names inside a composite slot in the intent and the phrases that should be added for each sub slot. Inside each composite slot hints, this structure provides a mechanism to add granular sub slot phrases. Only sub slot hints are supported for composite slots. The intent name, composite slot name and the constituent sub slot names must exist.

RuntimeHintDetails.documentation: Provides an array of phrases that should be given preference when resolving values for a slot.

phrase.documentation: The phrase that Amazon Lex should look for in the user's input to the bot.

RuntimeHintValue.documentation: Provides the phrase that Amazon Lex should look for in the user's input to the bot.

slotHints.documentation:
A list of the slots in the intent that should have runtime hints added, and the phrases that should be added for each slot.

The first level of the slotHints map is the name of the intent. The second level is the name of the slot within the intent. For more information, see Using hints to improve accuracy.

The intent name and slot name must exist.

RuntimeHints.documentation:
You can provide Amazon Lex with hints to the phrases that a customer is likely to use for a slot. When a slot with hints is resolved, the phrases in the runtime hints are preferred in the resolution. You can provide hints for a maximum of 100 intents. You can provide a maximum of 100 slots.

Before you can use runtime hints with an existing bot, you must first rebuild the bot.

For more information, see Using runtime hints to improve recognition of slot values.

slotResolutionImprovement.documentation: An object containing specifications for the assisted slot resolution feature.

nluImprovement.documentation: An object containing specifications for the assisted nlu feature.

RuntimeSettings.documentation: Contains specifications about the Amazon Lex runtime generative AI capabilities from Amazon Bedrock that you can turn on for your bot.

kmsKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) key for encrypting audio log files stored in an S3 bucket.

s3BucketArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon S3 bucket where audio log files are stored.

logPrefix.documentation: The S3 prefix to assign to audio log files.

S3BucketLogDestination.documentation: Specifies an Amazon S3 bucket for logging audio conversations

s3BucketName.documentation: The name of the bucket containing the transcript and the associated metadata.

pathFormat.documentation: The object that contains a path format that will be applied when Amazon Lex reads the transcript file in the bucket you provide. Specify this object if you only want Lex to read a subset of files in your Amazon S3 bucket.

transcriptFormat.documentation: The format of the transcript content. Currently, Genie only supports the Amazon Lex transcript format.

transcriptFilter.documentation: The object that contains the filter which will be applied when Amazon Lex reads through the Amazon S3 bucket. Specify this object if you want Amazon Lex to read only a subset of the Amazon S3 bucket based on the filter you provide.

kmsKeyArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that customer use to encrypt their Amazon S3 bucket. Only use this field if your bucket is encrypted using a customer managed KMS key.

S3BucketTranscriptSource.documentation: The object representing the Amazon S3 bucket containing the transcript, as well as the associated metadata.

value.documentation: The SSML text that defines the prompt.

SSMLMessage.documentation: Defines a Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML) prompt.

utterance.documentation: The sample utterance that Amazon Lex uses to build its machine-learning model to recognize intents.

SampleUtterance.documentation: A sample utterance that invokes an intent or respond to a slot elicitation prompt.

enabled.documentation: Specifies whether to enable sample utterance generation or not.

SampleUtteranceGenerationSpecification.documentation: Contains specifications for the sample utterance generation feature.

value.documentation: The value that can be used for a slot type.

SampleValue.documentation: Defines one of the values for a slot type.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot associated with the transcripts that you are searching.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the transcripts that you are searching.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the transcripts to search. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation associated with the transcripts to search.

searchOrder.documentation: How SearchResults are ordered. Valid values are Ascending or Descending. The default is Descending.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of bot recommendations to return in each page of results. If there are fewer results than the max page size, only the actual number of results are returned.

nextIndex.documentation: If the response from the SearchAssociatedTranscriptsRequest operation contains more results than specified in the maxResults parameter, an index is returned in the response. Use that index in the nextIndex parameter to return the next page of results.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot associated with the transcripts that you are searching.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the transcripts that you are searching.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the transcripts to search. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation associated with the transcripts to search.

nextIndex.documentation: A index that indicates whether there are more results to return in a response to the SearchAssociatedTranscripts operation. If the nextIndex field is present, you send the contents as the nextIndex parameter of a SearchAssociatedTranscriptsRequest operation to get the next page of results.

associatedTranscripts.documentation: The object that contains the associated transcript that meet the criteria you specified.

totalResults.documentation: The total number of transcripts returned by the search.

detectSentiment.documentation: Sets whether Amazon Lex uses Amazon Comprehend to detect the sentiment of user utterances.

SentimentAnalysisSettings.documentation: Determines whether Amazon Lex will use Amazon Comprehend to detect the sentiment of user utterances.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: You have reached a quota for your bot.

name.documentation:
The measure by which to sort the session analytics data.

  • conversationStartTime – The date and time when the conversation began. A conversation is defined as a unique combination of a sessionId and an originatingRequestId.

  • numberOfTurns – The number of turns that the session took.

  • conversationDurationSeconds – The duration of the conversation in seconds.

order.documentation: Specifies whether to sort the results in ascending or descending order.

SessionDataSortBy.documentation: An object specifying the measure and method by which to sort the session analytics data.

botAliasId.documentation: The identifier of the alias of the bot that the session was held with.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that the session was held with.

localeId.documentation: The locale of the bot that the session was held with.

channel.documentation: The channel that is integrated with the bot that the session was held with.

conversationStartTime.documentation: The date and time when the conversation began. A conversation is defined as a unique combination of a sessionId and an originatingRequestId.

conversationEndTime.documentation: The date and time when the conversation ended. A conversation is defined as a unique combination of a sessionId and an originatingRequestId.

conversationDurationSeconds.documentation: The duration of the conversation in seconds. A conversation is defined as a unique combination of a sessionId and an originatingRequestId.

conversationEndState.documentation: The final state of the conversation. A conversation is defined as a unique combination of a sessionId and an originatingRequestId.

mode.documentation:
The mode of the session. The possible values are as follows:

  • Speech – The session was spoken.

  • Text – The session was written.

  • DTMF – The session used a touch-tone keypad (Dual Tone Multi-Frequency).

  • MultiMode – The session used multiple modes.

numberOfTurns.documentation: The number of turns that the session took.

invokedIntentSamples.documentation: A list of objects containing the name of an intent that was invoked.

originatingRequestId.documentation: The identifier of the first request in a session.

SessionSpecification.documentation: An object containing information about a specific session.

captureNextStep.documentation: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the slot value is captured before the code hook times out.

captureConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate after the slot value is captured.

failureNextStep.documentation: Specifies the next step that the bot runs when the slot value code is not recognized.

failureConditional.documentation: A list of conditional branches to evaluate when the slot value isn't captured.

codeHook.documentation: Code hook called after Amazon Lex successfully captures a slot value.

elicitationCodeHook.documentation: Code hook called when Amazon Lex doesn't capture a slot value.

SlotCaptureSetting.documentation: Settings used when Amazon Lex successfully captures a slot value from a user.

defaultValue.documentation: The default value to use when a user doesn't provide a value for a slot.

SlotDefaultValue.documentation: Specifies the default value to use when a user doesn't provide a value for a slot.

defaultValueList.documentation: A list of default values. Amazon Lex chooses the default value to use in the order that they are presented in the list.

SlotDefaultValueSpecification.documentation: Defines a list of values that Amazon Lex should use as the default value for a slot.

name.documentation: The name of the field to use for filtering.

values.documentation: The value to use to filter the response.

operator.documentation: The operator to use for the filter. Specify EQ when the ListSlots operation should return only aliases that equal the specified value. Specify CO when the ListSlots operation should return aliases that contain the specified value.

priority.documentation: The priority that Amazon Lex should apply to the slot.

SlotPriority.documentation: Sets the priority that Amazon Lex should use when eliciting slot values from a user.

enabled.documentation: Specifies whether assisted slot resolution is turned on or off.

bedrockModelSpecification.documentation: An object containing information about the Amazon Bedrock model used to assist slot resolution.

SlotResolutionImprovementSpecification.documentation: Contains specifications for the assisted slot resolution feature.

slotResolutionStrategy.documentation: Specifies whether assisted slot resolution is turned on for the slot or not. If the value is EnhancedFallback, assisted slot resolution is activated when Amazon Lex defaults to the AMAZON.FallbackIntent. If the value is Default, assisted slot resolution is turned off.

SlotResolutionSetting.documentation: Contains information about whether assisted slot resolution is turned on for the slot or not.

resultCounts.documentation: A result for slot resolution in the results of a test execution.

SlotResolutionTestResultItem.documentation: Information about the success and failure rate of slot resolution in the results of a test execution.

speechTranscriptionResultCounts.documentation: The number of matched, mismatched and execution error results for speech transcription for the slot.

slotMatchResultCounts.documentation: The number of matched and mismatched results for slot resolution for the slot.

SlotResolutionTestResultItemCounts.documentation: Information about the counts for a slot resolution in the results of a test execution.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can choose ascending or descending.

SlotSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of bots.

slotConstraint.documentation: Whether the slot is required or optional. An intent is complete when all required slots are filled.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier for the slot type that defines the values for the slot.

valueElicitationPromptSpecification.documentation: Prompts that are sent to the user to elicit a value for the slot.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The timestamp of the last date and time that the slot was updated.

SlotSummary.documentation: Summary information about a slot, a value that the bot elicits from the user.

name.documentation: The name of the field to use for filtering.

values.documentation: The value to use to filter the response.

operator.documentation: The operator to use for the filter. Specify EQ when the ListSlotTypes operation should return only aliases that equal the specified value. Specify CO when the ListSlotTypes operation should return aliases that contain the specified value.

attribute.documentation: The attribute to use to sort the list of slot types.

order.documentation: The order to sort the list. You can say ascending or descending.

SlotTypeSortBy.documentation: Specifies attributes for sorting a list of slot types.

discoveredSlotTypeCount.documentation: The number of recommended slot types associated with the bot recommendation.

SlotTypeStatistics.documentation: The object that contains the statistical summary of the recommended slot type associated with the bot recommendation.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the slot type.

parentSlotTypeSignature.documentation: If the slot type is derived from a built-on slot type, the name of the parent slot type.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the slot type was last updated.

slotTypeCategory.documentation:
Indicates the type of the slot type.

  • Custom - A slot type that you created using custom values. For more information, see Creating custom slot types.

  • Extended - A slot type created by extending the AMAZON.AlphaNumeric built-in slot type. For more information, see AMAZON.AlphaNumeric .

  • ExternalGrammar - A slot type using a custom GRXML grammar to define values. For more information, see Using a custom grammar slot type.

SlotTypeSummary.documentation: Provides summary information about a slot type.

sampleValue.documentation: The value of the slot type entry.

synonyms.documentation: Additional values related to the slot type entry.

SlotTypeValue.documentation: Each slot type can have a set of values. Each SlotTypeValue represents a value that the slot type can take.

interpretedValue.documentation: The value that Amazon Lex determines for the slot. The actual value depends on the setting of the value selection strategy for the bot. You can choose to use the value entered by the user, or you can have Amazon Lex choose the first value in the resolvedValues list.

SlotValue.documentation: The value to set in a slot.

defaultValueSpecification.documentation: A list of default values for a slot. Default values are used when Amazon Lex hasn't determined a value for a slot. You can specify default values from context variables, session attributes, and defined values.

slotConstraint.documentation: Specifies whether the slot is required or optional.

promptSpecification.documentation: The prompt that Amazon Lex uses to elicit the slot value from the user.

sampleUtterances.documentation: If you know a specific pattern that users might respond to an Amazon Lex request for a slot value, you can provide those utterances to improve accuracy. This is optional. In most cases, Amazon Lex is capable of understanding user utterances.

slotCaptureSetting.documentation: Specifies the settings that Amazon Lex uses when a slot value is successfully entered by a user.

slotResolutionSetting.documentation: An object containing information about whether assisted slot resolution is turned on for the slot or not.

SlotValueElicitationSetting.documentation: Specifies the elicitation setting details eliciting a slot.

shape.documentation: When the shape value is List, it indicates that the values field contains a list of slot values. When the value is Scalar, it indicates that the value field contains a single value.

values.documentation: A list of one or more values that the user provided for the slot. For example, for a slot that elicits pizza toppings, the values might be "pepperoni" and "pineapple."

SlotValueOverride.documentation: The slot values that Amazon Lex uses when it sets slot values in a dialog step.

pattern.documentation:
A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

Use a standard regular expression. Amazon Lex supports the following characters in the regular expression:

  • A-Z, a-z

  • 0-9

  • Unicode characters ("\⁠u<Unicode>")

Represent Unicode characters with four digits, for example "\⁠u0041" or "\⁠u005A".

The following regular expression operators are not supported:

  • Infinite repeaters: *, +, or {x,} with no upper bound.

  • Wild card (.)

SlotValueRegexFilter.documentation: Provides a regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

resolutionStrategy.documentation:
Determines the slot resolution strategy that Amazon Lex uses to return slot type values. The field can be set to one of the following values:

  • ORIGINAL_VALUE - Returns the value entered by the user, if the user value is similar to the slot value.

  • TOP_RESOLUTION - If there is a resolution list for the slot, return the first value in the resolution list as the slot type value. If there is no resolution list, null is returned.

If you don't specify the valueSelectionStrategy, the default is ORIGINAL_VALUE.

regexFilter.documentation: A regular expression used to validate the value of a slot.

advancedRecognitionSetting.documentation: Provides settings that enable advanced recognition settings for slot values. You can use this to enable using slot values as a custom vocabulary for recognizing user utterances.

SlotValueSelectionSetting.documentation: Contains settings used by Amazon Lex to select a slot value.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to the slot type.

valueElicitationSetting.documentation: Specifies the elicitation setting details for constituent sub slots of a composite slot.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot containing the bot recommendation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the bot recommendation.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot recommendation to start. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

transcriptSourceSetting.documentation: The object representing the Amazon S3 bucket containing the transcript, as well as the associated metadata.

encryptionSetting.documentation: The object representing the passwords that will be used to encrypt the data related to the bot recommendation results, as well as the KMS key ARN used to encrypt the associated metadata.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot containing the bot recommendation.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the bot recommendation.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot recommendation to start. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

botRecommendationStatus.documentation:
The status of the bot recommendation.

If the status is Failed, then the reasons for the failure are listed in the failureReasons field.

botRecommendationId.documentation: The identifier of the bot recommendation that you have created.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot recommendation was created.

transcriptSourceSetting.documentation: The object representing the Amazon S3 bucket containing the transcript, as well as the associated metadata.

encryptionSetting.documentation: The object representing the passwords that were used to encrypt the data related to the bot recommendation results, as well as the KMS key ARN used to encrypt the associated metadata.

generationInputPrompt.documentation: The prompt to generate intents and slot types for the bot locale. Your description should be both detailed and precise to help generate appropriate and sufficient intents for your bot. Include a list of actions to improve the intent creation process.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot for which to generate intents and slot types.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot for which to generate intents and slot types.

localeId.documentation: The locale of the bot for which to generate intents and slot types.

generationInputPrompt.documentation: The prompt that was used generate intents and slot types for the bot locale.

generationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the generation request.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot for which the generation request was made.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot for which the generation request was made.

localeId.documentation: The locale of the bot for which the generation request was made.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time at which the generation request was made.

importId.documentation: The unique identifier for the import. It is included in the response from the CreateUploadUrl operation.

resourceSpecification.documentation: Parameters for creating the bot, bot locale or custom vocabulary.

mergeStrategy.documentation: The strategy to use when there is a name conflict between the imported resource and an existing resource. When the merge strategy is FailOnConflict existing resources are not overwritten and the import fails.

filePassword.documentation: The password used to encrypt the zip archive that contains the resource definition. You should always encrypt the zip archive to protect it during transit between your site and Amazon Lex.

resourceSpecification.documentation: The parameters used when importing the resource.

mergeStrategy.documentation: The strategy used when there was a name conflict between the imported resource and an existing resource. When the merge strategy is FailOnConflict existing resources are not overwritten and the import fails.

importStatus.documentation: The current status of the import. When the status is Complete the bot, bot alias, or custom vocabulary is ready to use.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the import request was created.

testSetId.documentation: The test set Id for the test set execution.

target.documentation: The target bot for the test set execution.

apiMode.documentation: Indicates whether we use streaming or non-streaming APIs for the test set execution. For streaming, StartConversation Runtime API is used. Whereas, for non-streaming, RecognizeUtterance and RecognizeText Amazon Lex Runtime API are used.

testExecutionModality.documentation: Indicates whether audio or text is used.

testExecutionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the test set execution.

creationDateTime.documentation: The creation date and time for the test set execution.

testSetId.documentation: The test set Id for the test set execution.

target.documentation: The target bot for the test set execution.

apiMode.documentation: Indicates whether we use streaming or non-streaming APIs for the test set execution. For streaming, StartConversation Amazon Lex Runtime API is used. Whereas for non-streaming, RecognizeUtterance and RecognizeText Amazon Lex Runtime API are used.

testExecutionModality.documentation: Indicates whether audio or text is used.

testSetName.documentation: The test set name for the test set generation request.

description.documentation: The test set description for the test set generation request.

storageLocation.documentation: The Amazon S3 storage location for the test set generation.

generationDataSource.documentation: The data source for the test set generation.

roleArn.documentation: The roleARN used for any operation in the test set to access resources in the Amazon Web Services account.

testSetTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the test set. You can only add tags when you import/generate a new test set. You can't use the UpdateTestSet operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

testSetGenerationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the test set generation to describe.

creationDateTime.documentation: The creation date and time for the test set generation.

testSetGenerationStatus.documentation: The status for the test set generation.

testSetName.documentation: The test set name used for the test set generation.

description.documentation: The description used for the test set generation.

storageLocation.documentation: The Amazon S3 storage location for the test set generation.

generationDataSource.documentation: The data source for the test set generation.

roleArn.documentation: The roleARN used for any operation in the test set to access resources in the Amazon Web Services account.

testSetTags.documentation: A list of tags that was used for the test set that is being generated.

messageGroups.documentation: One or more message groups, each containing one or more messages, that define the prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user.

frequencyInSeconds.documentation: How often a message should be sent to the user. Minimum of 1 second, maximum of 5 minutes.

timeoutInSeconds.documentation: If Amazon Lex waits longer than this length of time for a response, it will stop sending messages.

allowInterrupt.documentation: Indicates that the user can interrupt the response by speaking while the message is being played.

StillWaitingResponseSpecification.documentation: Defines the messages that Amazon Lex sends to a user to remind them that the bot is waiting for a response.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot containing the bot recommendation to be stopped.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the bot recommendation.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot recommendation to stop. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation to be stopped.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot containing the bot recommendation that is being stopped.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the recommendation that is being stopped.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot response to stop. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

botRecommendationStatus.documentation: The status of the bot recommendation. If the status is Failed, then the reasons for the failure are listed in the failureReasons field.

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation that is being stopped.

expression.documentation: The expression text for defining the constituent sub slots in the composite slot using logical AND and OR operators.

slotSpecifications.documentation: Specifications for the constituent sub slots of a composite slot.

SubSlotSetting.documentation: Specifications for the constituent sub slots and the expression for the composite slot.

name.documentation: Name of a constituent sub slot inside a composite slot.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier assigned to a slot type. This refers to either a built-in slot type or the unique slotTypeId of a custom slot type.

sampleUtterances.documentation: If you know a specific pattern that users might respond to an Amazon Lex request for a sub slot value, you can provide those utterances to improve accuracy. This is optional. In most cases Amazon Lex is capable of understanding user utterances. This is similar to SampleUtterances for slots.

SubSlotValueElicitationSetting.documentation:
Subslot elicitation settings.

DefaultValueSpecification is a list of default values for a constituent sub slot in a composite slot. Default values are used when Amazon Lex hasn't determined a value for a slot. You can specify default values from context variables, session attributes, and defined values. This is similar to DefaultValueSpecification for slots.

PromptSpecification is the prompt that Amazon Lex uses to elicit the sub slot value from the user. This is similar to PromptSpecification for slots.

resourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot, bot alias, or bot channel to tag.

tags.documentation: A list of tag keys to add to the resource. If a tag key already exists, the existing value is replaced with the new value.

resultTypeFilter.documentation: Specifies which results to filter. See Test result details">Test results details for details about different types of results.

conversationLevelTestResultsFilterBy.documentation: Contains information about the method for filtering Conversation level test results.

TestExecutionResultFilterBy.documentation: Contains information about the method by which to filter the results of the test execution.

overallTestResults.documentation: Overall results for the test execution, including the breakdown of conversations and single-input utterances.

conversationLevelTestResults.documentation: Results related to conversations in the test set, including metrics about success and failure of conversations and intent and slot failures.

intentClassificationTestResults.documentation: Intent recognition results aggregated by intent name. The aggregated results contain success and failure rates of intent recognition, speech transcriptions, and end-to-end conversations.

intentLevelSlotResolutionTestResults.documentation: Slot resolution results aggregated by intent and slot name. The aggregated results contain success and failure rates of slot resolution, speech transcriptions, and end-to-end conversations

utteranceLevelTestResults.documentation: Results related to utterances in the test set.

TestExecutionResultItems.documentation: Contains the results of the test execution, grouped by type of results. See Test result details">Test results details for details about different types of results.

attribute.documentation: Specifies whether to sort the test set executions by the date and time at which the test sets were created.

order.documentation: Specifies whether to sort in ascending or descending order.

TestExecutionSortBy.documentation: Contains information about the method by which to sort the instances of test executions you have carried out.

testExecutionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the test execution.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time at which the test execution was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time at which the test execution was last updated.

testExecutionStatus.documentation: The current status of the test execution.

testSetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the test set used in the test execution.

testSetName.documentation: The name of the test set used in the test execution.

target.documentation: Contains information about the bot used for the test execution..

apiMode.documentation: Specifies whether the API mode for the test execution is streaming or non-streaming.

testExecutionModality.documentation: Specifies whether the data used for the test execution is written or spoken.

botAliasTarget.documentation: Contains information about the bot alias used for the test execution.

TestExecutionTarget.documentation: Contains information about the bot used for the test execution.

intentDiscrepancies.documentation: Contains information about discrepancies found for intents between the test set and the bot.

slotDiscrepancies.documentation: Contains information about discrepancies found for slots between the test set and the bot.

TestSetDiscrepancyErrors.documentation: Contains details about the errors in the test set discrepancy report

botId.documentation: The unique identifier for the bot alias.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier for the bot associated with the bot alias.

localeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the locale associated with the bot alias.

TestSetDiscrepancyReportBotAliasTarget.documentation: Contains information about the bot alias used for the test set discrepancy report.

botAliasTarget.documentation: Contains information about the bot alias used as the resource for the test set discrepancy report.

TestSetDiscrepancyReportResourceTarget.documentation: Contains information about the resource used for the test set discrepancy report.

testSetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the test set.

TestSetExportSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the test set that is exported.

conversationLogsDataSource.documentation: Contains information about the bot from which the conversation logs are sourced.

TestSetGenerationDataSource.documentation: Contains information about the data source from which the test set is generated.

s3BucketName.documentation: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

s3Path.documentation: The path inside the Amazon S3 bucket pointing to the test-set CSV file.

TestSetImportInputLocation.documentation: Contains information about the Amazon S3 location from which the test set is imported.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the test set.

storageLocation.documentation: Contains information about the location that Amazon Lex uses to store the test-set.

importInputLocation.documentation: Contains information about the input location from where test-set should be imported.

modality.documentation: Specifies whether the test-set being imported contains written or spoken data.

testSetTags.documentation: A list of tags to add to the test set. You can only add tags when you import/generate a new test set. You can't use the UpdateTestSet operation to update tags. To update tags, use the TagResource operation.

TestSetImportResourceSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the test set that is imported.

intentName.documentation: The name of the intent in the discrepancy report.

errorMessage.documentation: The error message for a discrepancy for an intent between the test set and the bot.

TestSetIntentDiscrepancyItem.documentation: Contains information about discrepancy in an intent information between the test set and the bot.

intentName.documentation: The name of the intent associated with the slot in the discrepancy report.

slotName.documentation: The name of the slot in the discrepancy report.

errorMessage.documentation: The error message for a discrepancy for an intent between the test set and the bot.

TestSetSlotDiscrepancyItem.documentation: Contains information about discrepancy in a slot information between the test set and the bot.

attribute.documentation: Specifies whether to sort the test sets by name or by the time they were last updated.

order.documentation: Specifies whether to sort in ascending or descending order.

TestSetSortBy.documentation: Contains information about the methods by which to sort the test set.

s3BucketName.documentation: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket in which the test set is stored.

s3Path.documentation: The path inside the Amazon S3 bucket where the test set is stored.

kmsKeyArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (KMS) key for encrypting the test set.

TestSetStorageLocation.documentation: Contains information about the location in which the test set is stored.

testSetId.documentation: The unique identifier of the test set.

modality.documentation: Specifies whether the test set contains written or spoken data.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permission to access the test set.

numTurns.documentation: The number of turns in the test set.

storageLocation.documentation: Contains information about the location at which the test set is stored.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time at which the test set was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time at which the test set was last updated.

TestSetSummary.documentation: Contains summary information about the test set.

recordNumber.documentation: The record number associated with the turn.

conversationId.documentation: The unique identifier for the conversation associated with the turn.

turnNumber.documentation: The number of turns that has elapsed up to that turn.

turnSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the agent or user turn depending upon type of turn.

TestSetTurnRecord.documentation: Contains information about a turn in a test set.

agent.documentation: Contains information about the agent messages in the turn.

user.documentation: Contains information about the user messages in the turn.

TestSetTurnResult.documentation: Contains information about the results of the analysis of a turn in the test set.

startTimeoutMs.documentation: Time for which a bot waits before re-prompting a customer for text input.

cloudWatch.documentation: Defines the Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group where text and metadata logs are delivered.

TextLogDestination.documentation: Defines the Amazon CloudWatch Logs destination log group for conversation text logs.

enabled.documentation: Determines whether conversation logs should be stored for an alias.

selectiveLoggingEnabled.documentation: The option to enable selective conversation log capture for text.

TextLogSetting.documentation: Defines settings to enable text conversation logs.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds after which the user can invoke the API again.

ThrottlingException.documentation: Your request rate is too high. Reduce the frequency of requests.

lexTranscriptFilter.documentation: The object representing the filter that Amazon Lex will use to select the appropriate transcript when the transcript format is the Amazon Lex format.

TranscriptFilter.documentation: The object representing the filter that Amazon Lex will use to select the appropriate transcript.

s3BucketTranscriptSource.documentation: Indicates the setting of the Amazon S3 bucket where the transcript is stored.

TranscriptSourceSetting.documentation: Indicates the setting of the location where the transcript is stored.

agentTurn.documentation: Contains information about the agent messages in the turn.

userTurn.documentation: Contains information about the user messages in the turn.

TurnSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the messages in the turn.

resourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to remove the tags from.

tagKeys.documentation: A list of tag keys to remove from the resource. If a tag key does not exist on the resource, it is ignored.

botAliasId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot alias.

botAliasName.documentation: The new name to assign to the bot alias.

description.documentation: The new description to assign to the bot alias.

botVersion.documentation: The new bot version to assign to the bot alias.

botAliasLocaleSettings.documentation: The new Lambda functions to use in each locale for the bot alias.

conversationLogSettings.documentation: The new settings for storing conversation logs in Amazon CloudWatch Logs and Amazon S3 buckets.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot with the updated alias.

botAliasId.documentation: The identifier of the updated bot alias.

botAliasName.documentation: The updated name of the bot alias.

description.documentation: The updated description of the bot alias.

botVersion.documentation: The updated version of the bot that the alias points to.

botAliasLocaleSettings.documentation: The updated Lambda functions to use in each locale for the bot alias.

conversationLogSettings.documentation: The updated settings for storing conversation logs in Amazon CloudWatch Logs and Amazon S3 buckets.

botAliasStatus.documentation: The current status of the bot alias. When the status is Available the alias is ready for use.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot with the updated alias.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was last updated.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that contains the locale.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the locale to be updated. The version can only be the DRAFT version.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale to update. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation: The new confidence threshold where Amazon Lex inserts the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents in the list of possible intents for an utterance.

voiceSettings.documentation: The new Amazon Polly voice Amazon Lex should use for voice interaction with the user.

generativeAISettings.documentation: Contains settings for generative AI features powered by Amazon Bedrock for your bot locale. Use this object to turn generative AI features on and off. Pricing may differ if you turn a feature on. For more information, see LINK.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the updated locale.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the updated locale.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale of the updated bot locale.

localeName.documentation: The updated locale name for the locale.

nluIntentConfidenceThreshold.documentation: The updated confidence threshold for inserting the AMAZON.FallbackIntent and AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intents in the list of possible intents for an utterance.

voiceSettings.documentation: The updated Amazon Polly voice to use for voice interaction with the user.

botLocaleStatus.documentation: The current status of the locale. When the bot status is Built the locale is ready for use.

failureReasons.documentation: If the botLocaleStatus is Failed, the failureReasons field lists the errors that occurred while building the bot.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the locale was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the locale was last updated.

recommendedActions.documentation: Recommended actions to take to resolve an error in the failureReasons field.

generativeAISettings.documentation: Contains settings for generative AI features powered by Amazon Bedrock for your bot locale.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot containing the bot recommendation to be updated.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the bot recommendation to be updated.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot recommendation to update. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation to be updated.

encryptionSetting.documentation: The object representing the passwords that will be used to encrypt the data related to the bot recommendation results, as well as the KMS key ARN used to encrypt the associated metadata.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot containing the bot recommendation that has been updated.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot containing the bot recommendation that has been updated.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale of the bot recommendation to update. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages

botRecommendationStatus.documentation:
The status of the bot recommendation.

If the status is Failed, then the reasons for the failure are listed in the failureReasons field.

botRecommendationId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot recommendation to be updated.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot recommendation was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot recommendation was last updated.

transcriptSourceSetting.documentation: The object representing the Amazon S3 bucket containing the transcript, as well as the associated metadata.

encryptionSetting.documentation: The object representing the passwords that were used to encrypt the data related to the bot recommendation results, as well as the KMS key ARN used to encrypt the associated metadata.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot to update. This identifier is returned by the CreateBot operation.

botName.documentation: The new name of the bot. The name must be unique in the account that creates the bot.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that has permissions to access the bot.

dataPrivacy.documentation: Provides information on additional privacy protections Amazon Lex should use with the bot's data.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation:
The time, in seconds, that Amazon Lex should keep information about a user's conversation with the bot.

A user interaction remains active for the amount of time specified. If no conversation occurs during this time, the session expires and Amazon Lex deletes any data provided before the timeout.

You can specify between 60 (1 minute) and 86,400 (24 hours) seconds.

botType.documentation: The type of the bot to be updated.

botMembers.documentation: The list of bot members in the network associated with the update action.

errorLogSettings.documentation: Allows you to modify how Amazon Lex logs errors during bot interactions, including destinations for error logs and the types of errors to be captured.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that was updated.

botName.documentation: The name of the bot after the update.

description.documentation: The description of the bot after the update.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the bot after the update.

dataPrivacy.documentation: The data privacy settings for the bot after the update.

idleSessionTTLInSeconds.documentation: The session timeout, in seconds, for the bot after the update.

botStatus.documentation: Shows the current status of the bot. The bot is first in the Creating status. Once the bot is read for use, it changes to the Available status. After the bot is created, you can use the DRAFT version of the bot.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the bot was last updated.

botType.documentation: The type of the bot that was updated.

botMembers.documentation: The list of bot members in the network that was updated.

errorLogSettings.documentation: Settings for managing error logs within the response of an update bot operation.

exportId.documentation: The unique identifier Amazon Lex assigned to the export.

filePassword.documentation: The new password to use to encrypt the export zip archive.

exportId.documentation: The unique identifier Amazon Lex assigned to the export.

resourceSpecification.documentation: A description of the type of resource that was exported, either a bot or a bot locale.

fileFormat.documentation: The file format used for the files that define the resource. The TSV format is required to export a custom vocabulary only; otherwise use LexJson format.

exportStatus.documentation: The status of the export. When the status is Completed the export archive is available for download.

creationDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the export was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time that the export was last updated.

intentId.documentation: The unique identifier of the intent to update.

parentIntentSignature.documentation: The signature of the new built-in intent to use as the parent of this intent.

sampleUtterances.documentation: New utterances used to invoke the intent.

dialogCodeHook.documentation: The new Lambda function to use between each turn of the conversation with the bot.

fulfillmentCodeHook.documentation: The new Lambda function to call when all of the intents required slots are provided and the intent is ready for fulfillment.

slotPriorities.documentation: A new list of slots and their priorities that are contained by the intent.

intentConfirmationSetting.documentation: New prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to confirm the completion of an intent.

intentClosingSetting.documentation: The new response that Amazon Lex sends the user when the intent is closed.

inputContexts.documentation: A new list of contexts that must be active in order for Amazon Lex to consider the intent.

outputContexts.documentation: A new list of contexts that Amazon Lex activates when the intent is fulfilled.

kendraConfiguration.documentation: New configuration settings for connecting to an Amazon Kendra index.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the intent.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the intent. Must be DRAFT.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale where this intent is used. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

initialResponseSetting.documentation: Configuration settings for a response sent to the user before Amazon Lex starts eliciting slots.

qnAIntentConfiguration.documentation: Specifies the configuration of the built-in Amazon.QnAIntent. The AMAZON.QnAIntent intent is called when Amazon Lex can't determine another intent to invoke. If you specify this field, you can't specify the kendraConfiguration field.

qInConnectIntentConfiguration.documentation: Qinconnect intent configuration details for the update intent request.

intentId.documentation: The identifier of the intent that was updated.

parentIntentSignature.documentation: The updated built-in intent that is the parent of this intent.

sampleUtterances.documentation: The updated list of sample utterances for the intent.

dialogCodeHook.documentation: The updated Lambda function called during each turn of the conversation with the user.

fulfillmentCodeHook.documentation: The updated Lambda function called when the intent is ready for fulfillment.

slotPriorities.documentation: The updated list of slots and their priorities that are elicited from the user for the intent.

intentConfirmationSetting.documentation: The updated prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to confirm the completion of an intent.

intentClosingSetting.documentation: The updated response that Amazon Lex sends the user when the intent is closed.

inputContexts.documentation: The updated list of contexts that must be active for the intent to be considered by Amazon Lex.

outputContexts.documentation: The updated list of contexts that Amazon Lex activates when the intent is fulfilled.

kendraConfiguration.documentation: The updated configuration for connecting to an Amazon Kendra index with the AMAZON.KendraSearchIntent intent.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the intent.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the intent. Will always be DRAFT.

localeId.documentation: The updated language and locale of the intent.

creationDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of when the intent was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the last time that the intent was modified.

initialResponseSetting.documentation: Configuration settings for a response sent to the user before Amazon Lex starts eliciting slots.

qnAIntentConfiguration.documentation: Details about the configuration of the built-in Amazon.QnAIntent.

qInConnectIntentConfiguration.documentation: Qinconnect intent configuration details for the update intent response.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

policy.documentation:
A resource policy to add to the resource. The policy is a JSON structure that contains one or more statements that define the policy. The policy must follow the IAM syntax. For more information about the contents of a JSON policy document, see IAM JSON policy reference .

If the policy isn't valid, Amazon Lex returns a validation exception.

expectedRevisionId.documentation:
The identifier of the revision of the policy to update. If this revision ID doesn't match the current revision ID, Amazon Lex throws an exception.

If you don't specify a revision, Amazon Lex overwrites the contents of the policy with the new values.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bot or bot alias that the resource policy is attached to.

revisionId.documentation: The current revision of the resource policy. Use the revision ID to make sure that you are updating the most current version of a resource policy when you add a policy statement to a resource, delete a resource, or update a resource.

slotId.documentation: The unique identifier for the slot to update.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the new slot type to associate with this slot.

valueElicitationSetting.documentation: A new set of prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to elicit a response the provides a value for the slot.

obfuscationSetting.documentation: New settings that determine how slot values are formatted in Amazon CloudWatch logs.

botId.documentation: The unique identifier of the bot that contains the slot.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the slot. Must always be DRAFT.

localeId.documentation: The identifier of the language and locale that contains the slot. The string must match one of the supported locales. For more information, see Supported languages.

intentId.documentation: The identifier of the intent that contains the slot.

multipleValuesSetting.documentation:
Determines whether the slot accepts multiple values in one response. Multiple value slots are only available in the en-US locale. If you set this value to true in any other locale, Amazon Lex throws a ValidationException.

If the multipleValuesSetting is not set, the default value is false.

subSlotSetting.documentation: Specifications for the constituent sub slots and the expression for the composite slot.

slotId.documentation: The unique identifier of the slot that was updated.

slotTypeId.documentation: The updated identifier of the slot type that provides values for the slot.

valueElicitationSetting.documentation: The updated prompts that Amazon Lex sends to the user to elicit a response that provides a value for the slot.

obfuscationSetting.documentation: The updated setting that determines whether the slot value is obfuscated in the Amazon CloudWatch logs.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the slot. Will always be DRAFT.

localeId.documentation: The locale that contains the slot.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The timestamp of the date and time that the slot was last updated.

slotTypeName.documentation: The new name of the slot type.

description.documentation: The new description of the slot type.

slotTypeValues.documentation: A new list of values and their optional synonyms that define the values that the slot type can take.

valueSelectionSetting.documentation: The strategy that Amazon Lex should use when deciding on a value from the list of slot type values.

parentSlotTypeSignature.documentation: The new built-in slot type that should be used as the parent of this slot type.

slotTypeId.documentation: The unique identifier of the updated slot type.

slotTypeName.documentation: The updated name of the slot type.

description.documentation: The updated description of the slot type.

slotTypeValues.documentation: The updated values that the slot type provides.

valueSelectionSetting.documentation: The updated strategy that Amazon Lex uses to determine which value to select from the slot type.

parentSlotTypeSignature.documentation: The updated signature of the built-in slot type that is the parent of this slot type.

botId.documentation: The identifier of the bot that contains the slot type.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that contains the slot type. This is always DRAFT.

localeId.documentation: The language and locale of the updated slot type.

creationDateTime.documentation: The timestamp of the date and time that the slot type was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: A timestamp of the date and time that the slot type was last updated.

testSetId.documentation: The test set Id for which update test operation to be performed.
The test set Id for which update test operation to be performed.

testSetName.documentation: The test set name for the updated test set.

description.documentation: The test set description for the updated test set.

modality.documentation: Indicates whether audio or text is used for the updated test set.

status.documentation: The status for the updated test set.

roleArn.documentation: The roleARN used for any operation in the test set to access resources in the Amazon Web Services account.

numTurns.documentation: The number of conversation turns from the updated test set.

storageLocation.documentation: The Amazon S3 storage location for the updated test set.

creationDateTime.documentation: The creation date and time for the updated test set.

lastUpdatedDateTime.documentation: The date and time of the last update for the updated test set.

utteranceInput.documentation: The utterance input in the user turn.

sessionState.documentation: Contains information about the session state in the input.

UserTurnInputSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the user messages in the turn in the input.

name.documentation: The name of the intent.

UserTurnIntentOutput.documentation: Contains information about the intent that is output for the turn by the test execution.

activeContexts.documentation: The contexts that are active in the turn.

transcript.documentation: The transcript that is output for the user turn by the test execution.

UserTurnOutputSpecification.documentation: Contains results that are output for the user turn by the test execution.

input.documentation: Contains information about the user messages in the turn in the input.

expectedOutput.documentation: Contains information about the expected output for the user turn.

actualOutput.documentation: Contains information about the actual output for the user turn.

endToEndResult.documentation: Specifies whether the expected and actual outputs match or not, or if there is an error in execution.

intentMatchResult.documentation: Specifies whether the expected and actual intents match or not.

slotMatchResult.documentation: Specifies whether the expected and actual slots match or not.

speechTranscriptionResult.documentation: Specifies whether the expected and actual speech transcriptions match or not, or if there is an error in execution.

conversationLevelResult.documentation: Contains information about the results related to the conversation associated with the user turn.

UserTurnResult.documentation: Contains the results for the user turn by the test execution.

value.documentation: The value output by the slot recognition.

values.documentation: Values that are output by the slot recognition.

subSlots.documentation: A list of items mapping the name of the subslots to information about those subslots.

UserTurnSlotOutput.documentation: Contains information about a slot output by the test set execution.

input.documentation: Contains information about the user messages in the turn in the input.

expected.documentation: Contains results about the expected output for the user turn.

UserTurnSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the expected and input values for the user turn.

relativeAggregationDuration.documentation: The desired time window for aggregating utterances.

UtteranceAggregationDuration.documentation: Provides parameters for setting the time window and duration for aggregating utterance data.

audioFileS3Location.documentation: Amazon S3 file pointing to the audio.

UtteranceAudioInputSpecification.documentation: Contains information about the audio for an utterance.

content.documentation: The text of the response to the utterance from the bot.

contentType.documentation:
The type of the response. The following values are possible:

  • PlainText – A plain text string.

  • CustomPayload – A response string that you can customize to include data or metadata for your application.

  • SSML – A string that includes Speech Synthesis Markup Language to customize the audio response.

  • ImageResponseCard – An image with buttons that the customer can select. See ImageResponseCard for more information.

UtteranceBotResponse.documentation: An object that contains a response to the utterance from the bot.

name.documentation:
The measure by which to sort the utterance analytics data.

  • Count – The number of utterances.

  • UtteranceTimestamp – The date and time of the utterance.

order.documentation: Specifies whether to sort the results in ascending or descending order.

UtteranceDataSortBy.documentation: An object specifying the measure and method by which to sort the utterance data.

textInput.documentation: A text input transcription of the utterance. It is only applicable for test-sets containing text data.

audioInput.documentation: Contains information about the audio input for an utterance.

UtteranceInputSpecification.documentation: Contains information about input of an utterance.

conversationId.documentation: The unique identifier for the conversation associated with the result.

turnResult.documentation: Contains information about the turn associated with the result.

UtteranceLevelTestResultItem.documentation: Contains information about multiple utterances in the results of a test set execution.

items.documentation: Contains information about an utterance in the results of the test set execution.

UtteranceLevelTestResults.documentation: Contains information about the utterances in the results of the test set execution.

botAliasId.documentation: The identifier of the alias of the bot that the utterance was made to.

botVersion.documentation: The version of the bot that the utterance was made to.

localeId.documentation: The locale of the bot that the utterance was made to.

sessionId.documentation: The identifier of the session that the utterance was made in.

channel.documentation: The channel that is integrated with the bot that the utterance was made to.

mode.documentation:
The mode of the session. The possible values are as follows:

  • Speech – The session consisted of spoken dialogue.

  • Text – The session consisted of written dialogue.

  • DTMF – The session consisted of touch-tone keypad (Dual Tone Multi-Frequency) key presses.

  • MultiMode – The session consisted of multiple modes.

conversationStartTime.documentation: The date and time when the conversation in which the utterance took place began. A conversation is defined as a unique combination of a sessionId and an originatingRequestId.

conversationEndTime.documentation: The date and time when the conversation in which the utterance took place ended. A conversation is defined as a unique combination of a sessionId and an originatingRequestId.

utteranceTimestamp.documentation: The date and time when the utterance took place.

audioVoiceDurationMillis.documentation: The duration in milliseconds of the audio associated with the utterance.

utteranceUnderstood.documentation: Specifies whether the bot understood the utterance or not.

inputType.documentation:
The input type of the utterance. The possible values are as follows:

  • PCM format: audio data must be in little-endian byte order.

    • audio/l16; rate=16000; channels=1

    • audio/x-l16; sample-rate=16000; channel-count=1

    • audio/lpcm; sample-rate=8000; sample-size-bits=16; channel-count=1; is-big-endian=false

  • Opus format

    • audio/x-cbr-opus-with-preamble;preamble-size=0;bit-rate=256000;frame-size-milliseconds=4

  • Text format

    • text/plain; charset=utf-8

outputType.documentation:
The output type of the utterance. The possible values are as follows:

  • audio/mpeg

  • audio/ogg

  • audio/pcm (16 KHz)

  • audio/ (defaults to mpeg)

  • text/plain; charset=utf-8

associatedIntentName.documentation: The name of the intent that the utterance is associated to.

associatedSlotName.documentation: The name of the slot that the utterance is associated to.

intentState.documentation: The state of the intent that the utterance is associated to.

dialogActionType.documentation: The type of dialog action that the utterance is associated to. See the type field in DialogAction for more information.

botResponseAudioVoiceId.documentation: The identifier for the audio of the bot response.

slotsFilledInSession.documentation: The slots that have been filled in the session by the time of the utterance.

utteranceRequestId.documentation: The identifier of the request associated with the utterance.

botResponses.documentation: A list of objects containing information about the bot response to the utterance.

UtteranceSpecification.documentation: An object containing information about a specific utterance.

ValidationException.documentation: One of the input parameters in your request isn't valid. Check the parameters and try your request again.

voiceId.documentation: The identifier of the Amazon Polly voice to use.

engine.documentation:
Indicates the type of Amazon Polly voice that Amazon Lex should use for voice interaction with the user. For more information, see the engine parameter of the SynthesizeSpeech operation in the Amazon Polly developer guide.

If you do not specify a value, the default is standard.

VoiceSettings.documentation:
Defines settings for using an Amazon Polly voice to communicate with a user.

Valid values include:

  • standard

  • neural

  • long-form

  • generative

waitingResponse.documentation: The response that Amazon Lex sends to indicate that the bot is waiting for the conversation to continue.

continueResponse.documentation: The response that Amazon Lex sends to indicate that the bot is ready to continue the conversation.

stillWaitingResponse.documentation: A response that Amazon Lex sends periodically to the user to indicate that the bot is still waiting for input from the user.

active.documentation: Specifies whether the bot will wait for a user to respond. When this field is false, wait and continue responses for a slot aren't used. If the active field isn't specified, the default is true.

WaitAndContinueSpecification.documentation: Specifies the prompts that Amazon Lex uses while a bot is waiting for customer input.
